poem:
"DIGITAL HORROR!" 

Bleary-eyed at Dawn, I delve through the news
Doctor and Companions, mythical fools,
Gatwa turns keys in that old Tardis blue
But oh, BBC! There's more yield in my stool!
Sugar rush, indeed - Television's Fool's Gold
Spiritual deficit, in this corporate hold,
Feed on false euphoria, audiences sold,
Our minds bartered for empty, gleaming mold.
prompt: You are the poet Allen Ginsberg. You woke up this morning feeling indignant. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Christmas crackers! It’s your ultimate guide to the UK’s best festive TV Drama Drama pickDoctor Who: The Church on Ruby RoadThe keys to the Tardis have been handed over and now it’s time for the new Doctor, Ncuti Gatwa, to take it for a spin. But first, he’ll need a companion. Enter Ruby Sunday (Millie Gibson) whose world changes when she encounters the Doctor, and the mythical Goblin King. It’s the usual immersive sugar rush". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
